DataElement.preferredName: OARS Physical Health Comorbidity Scale Have Current Illness Pulmonary Emphysema Or Chronic Bronchitis Symptoms Interfere with Life 3 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how much emphysema or chronic bronchitis interferes with their activities, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: OARS Physical Health Comorbidity Scale Have Current Illness Pulmonary Emphysema Or Chronic Bronchitis Symptoms Interfere with Life
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function._A question about whether an individual currently has a disease._A subcategory of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It occurs in people who smoke and suffer from chronic bronchitis. It is characterized by inflation of the alveoli, alveolar wall damage, and reduction in the number of alveoli, resulting in difficulty breathing._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._condition characterized by persistent coughing, increased secretion from the bronchial mucosa, obstruction of the respiratory passages, scanty or profuse expectoration, and necrosis and fibrosis of the respiratory tract._A question about an individual feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Older Americans Resources and Services Comorbidity Scale
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function.

Concepts.longName: Older Americans Resources and Services Comorbidity Scale
Concepts.definition: A section of the Older Americans Resources and Services (OARS) physical health questionnaire that rates the type of comorbidity and the impact of that comorbidity on an individual's daily function.

Property.preferredName: Have Current Illness Pulmonary Emphysema Or Chronic Bronchitis Symptoms Interfere with Life
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.:A subcategory of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It occurs in people who smoke and suffer from chronic bronchitis. It is characterized by inflation of the alveoli, alveolar wall damage, and reduction in the number of alveoli, resulting in difficulty breathing.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:condition characterized by persistent coughing, increased secretion from the bronchial mucosa, obstruction of the respiratory passages, scanty or profuse expectoration, and necrosis and fibrosis of the respiratory tract.:A question about an individual's feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual currently has a disease.

A subcategory of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It occurs in people who smoke and suffer from chronic bronchitis. It is characterized by inflation of the alveoli, alveolar wall damage, and reduction in the number of alveoli, resulting in difficulty breathing.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A type of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease characterized by chronic inflammation in the bronchial tree that results in edema, mucus production, obstruction, and reduced airflow to and from the lung alveoli.  The most common cause is tobacco smoking.  Signs and symptoms include coughing with excessive mucus production, and shortness of breath.
A question about an individual feeling that symptoms are or were interfering with their life.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._an ordered reference standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
